room SH 243 (Senate House). History and Memory Methods<br><br>11.00<br><br>Historical methods and archives: Dr Carlos Galviz (IHR and RHUL)<br><br>12.00<br><br>Introduction to oral history, fieldwork and collections: Dr Michael Kandiah (King's)<br><br>1.00<br><br>Lunch break<br><br>2.30-5.00<br><br>5.00-6.00<br><br>Memories: from Field to File (includes workshop Memory hunt): Dr Claudia J\ufffd\ufffdnke (Bonn), Dr Samuel Merrill (IMLR) and Dr Katia Pizzi (IMLR)<br>*please bring a camera phone or digital camera* [...] Graeme Farnell 2015-02-25T10:58:11+00:00 2015-02-25T10:58:11+00:00 Call for Papers: Interpreting the Art Museum https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;7821f06.1502 We invite international submissions to be included in this forthcoming<br>collection of essays to be published by MuseumsEtc [www.museumsetc.com] in<br>2015.<br><br>The full Call for Papers may be downloaded here: http://bit.ly/IAMCFP<br><br>Interpretation aims to do more than simply communicate facts. It uses<br>original objects, first-hand experiences, and media to communicate meaning<br>and understanding.<br><br>Unlike most other museum disciplines, interpretation within art museums<br>poses a range of particularly challenging - even contentious - issues.<br>Among them:<br>* a concern not to spoil the direct, often sensitive, relationship between<br>the viewer and the work of art;<br>* the perceived difficulty of tackling [...] Graeme Farnell 2015-02-25T09:45:51+00:00 2015-02-25T09:45:51+00:00 Announcing the Academic Museums Collection https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;5ddd9444.1502 List members may be interested in this series of books - now released in<br>new colour editions - for a short time available with over 30% savings and<br>free worldwide shipping.<br><br>"A vital resource... the standard text for generations to come."<br>James Cuno, President & CEO, The J. Paul Getty Trust.<br><br>For ANY museum which aspires to an academic role, this acclaimed<br>1,814-page, three-volume collection is an invaluable source of inspiration,<br>ideas, successful strategies and best practices. The successful applicant will join an interdisciplinary research studio with expertise in curating, contemporary visual art practice, new media art, information visualisation, art and science collaborations, and design, with a strong international research track record. The candidate will have opportunities for collaborative research with museums, galleries, and [...] Suzon Fuks 2015-02-20T17:22:49+10:00 2015-02-20T17:22:49+10:00 call to virtual exhibition - deadline extended https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;6bc5a9a7.1502 Dear Artnet members,<br><br>I'd like to inform you that the deadline for submitting works to the<br>virtual exhibition "HOT WATER \ufffd\ufffd Water, Peace & War" has been extended to<br>the 14 March 2015.<br>~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~<br><br>Artists, scientists, activists, teachers, youth are invited to upload<br>videos, digital postcards, poems or texts on the theme of \ufffd\ufffdHOT WATER\ufffd\ufffd:<br>climate change, environmental decline, rights violations, volatile<br>politics and conflict about water.<br>INFO http://bit.ly/HOT-WATER [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-02-19T14:33:54+00:00 2015-02-19T14:33:54+00:00 CFP The Gendered Politics of Production: Girls and Women as Media Producers June 16, 2015 at Middlesex University London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;a092f712.1502 On behalf of "Feona Attwood" <F.Attwood@MDX.AC.UK> wrote:<br><br>>CFP The Gendered Politics of Production: Girls and Women as Media<br>>Producers<br>>Tuesday June 16, 2015 at Middlesex University London<br>>Keynote Speaker: Professor Mary Celeste Kearney (University of Notre<br>>Dame, USA)<br>><br>>Girls and women are arguably producing more media than ever before. As<br>>bloggers, vloggers and \ufffd\ufffdtweeters\ufffd\ufffd, filmmakers, television showrunners, web<br>>designers, game developers, and musicians \ufffd\ufffd to name only a few \ufffd\ufffd girls and<br>>women are active contributors to contemporary media production cultures.<br>>Yet, recent incidents such as Gamergate point to the continuous precarious<br>>positioning that girls and women occupy as [...] Kip Jones 2015-02-18T10:22:11+00:00 2015-02-18T10:22:11+00:00 "A Report on an Arts-Led, Emotive Experiment in Interviewing and Storytelling" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;6053d317.1502 Just published in The Qualitative Report, details of a two-day experiment with using ephemera to illicit biographic narratives, then producing short presentations about them creatively.\ufffd\ufffd"The best event I've participated in for a very longtime!" \ufffd\ufffd"One of the most enlightening workshops I haveattended"\ufffd\ufffd"Inspiring. An artful and generativesuspension of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdnormal\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd activity".\ufffd\ufffd"I can\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt remember ever attending such an inspiring event in house.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>A Report on an Arts-Led, Emotive Experiment in Interviewing and Storytelling [...] Valerie Walkerdine 2015-02-17T11:31:21+00:00 2015-02-17T11:31:21+00:00 call for papers Mothering and creative practice https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;90496510.1502 Call for Papers<br>Motherhood and creative practice:<br>Maternal structures in creative work<br><br>June 1-2, 2015<br>Centre for Media and Culture Research, School of Arts and Creative Industries, London South Bank University<br>Submission deadline 4 March 2015<br><br>Confirmed Key Note Speakers:<br>Professor Bracha L. Ettinger, Marcel Duchamp Chair & Professor of Psychoanalysis and Art at the European Graduate School [...] Katrin Joost 2015-02-16T19:40:17+00:00 2015-02-16T19:40:17+00:00 Visualising the Animal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;e756a5d7.1502 Visualising the Animal<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS: 15th March<br>A conference bringing together theorists and practitioners in the field of photography rethinking visualisations of animals<br><br>18th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 19th June 2015 : University of Cumbria<br><br>Confirmed speakers:<br>Steve Baker, Emeritus Professor in Art History, University of Central Lancashire<br>John Darwell, Independent Photographer and Reader in Photography, University of Cumbria [...] Roy ,Elodie Amandine 2015-02-16T12:18:52-00:00 2015-02-16T12:18:52-00:00 CfP Reminder: Material Culture in Action - 7-8 September 2015 - Glasgow School of Art https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;65254121.1502 Call for Papers:<br><br>Material Culture in Action:<br>Practices of making, collecting and re-enacting art and design<br><br>Glasgow School of Art, UK<br>DATES: 7-8 September 2015,<br><br>Keynote speakers:<br>Prof Guy Julier<br>Prof Esther Leslie<br>Ian Helliwell<br><br>Closing remarks by Prof Tim Ingold<br><br>This two-day international conference will investigate new directions in material culture studies by focusing on creative, critical and theoretical engagement with the material culture of art and design, both within and beyond the art school. The material culture of art and design covers a wide range of art practices, from professionally designed works within the art school, to the [...] SUBSCRIBE AAH-HE-ISSUES Anonymous 2015-02-13T15:41:22+00:00 2015-02-13T15:41:22+00:00 CfP: 'Fashion and Art History', AAH Summer Symposium, York, 29-30 June 2015, Deadline: 27.3.2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;9a105274.1502 The Association of Art Historians (AAH) Summer Symposium is a two-day annual conference highlighting post-graduate research. It takes place at a different university each year in early Summer.<br><br>'Fashion & Art History\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>University of York<br>29 - 30 June 2015<br><br>Fashion and art often follow a shared trajectory of social, political, and historical circumstances. In collaboration with the University of York, the AAH\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds annual Student Summer Symposium will explore the relationship between fashion and art, by inviting papers that engage with this subject across a wide range of chronological and theoretical perspectives.<br>The influence of fashionable dress on artists and [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-02-10T11:07:36+00:00 2015-02-10T11:07:36+00:00 CFP The Journal of Comparative Media Arts (CMA Journal) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;3cc91410.1502 On behalf of Jorma Kujala [jkujala@sfu.ca] CMA Journal: Call for Submissions The Journal of Comparative Media Arts (CMA Journal) is an open-access, student-run peer-reviewed journal, taking up discussions and investigations within the creative, critical and cultural communities(for further information, please visit us at http://cmajournal.ca/). Our goal is to publish the best of graduate, postgraduate and recent graduate essays and dissertations, presenting the pluralism of research within arts and culture and a forum for scholarly discourse. Engaging a transdisciplinary perspective, the CMA Journal encompasses contemporary concerns with a focus on visual arts and art history, cinema and moving-image studies, performance studies, [...] Horea Avram 2015-02-09T17:07:01+00:00 2015-02-09T17:07:01+00:00 Reminder - Call for papers: Provocation as Art. Scandal, Shock and Sexuality in Contemporary Visual Culture https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;91841a89.1502 Call for papers<br>Provocation as Art.<br>Scandal, Shock and Sexuality in Contemporary Visual Culture<br><br>2nd Ekphrasis Conference on Cinema and Visual Culture<br>28-29 May, 2015, Cluj, Romania<br><br>The Faculty of Theater and Television of the Babe\ufffd\ufffd-Bolyai University is announcing the Call for Papers for the Annual Cinema and Visual Culture Studies Conference to be held May 28-29, 2015. This 2015 conference is designed to discuss the irreverent nature of art, cinema and visual production in various media environments. The purpose of the conference is to deal with the various obstructions of the creative spirit, both in the context of the [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-02-04T20:31:58+00:00 2015-02-04T20:31:58+00:00 [2nd CfP] MOCO15 (International Workshop on Movement and Computing) Submission deadline: 1st of March2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;cb6b0d66.1502 ========================= We would like to announce the second Call for Papers for the International Workshop on Movement and Computing (MOCO15) located co-located with ISEA2015 at Simon Fraser University, Vancouver Canada August 14-15 2015. People who are attending ISEA2015 will have a reduced registration fee for MOCO. We will have 3 keynotes spanning Dance theory, Neuroscience, and Computer Science We will also organize a highly acclaimed dance and technology performance by the french Company Adrien M | Claire B, called "Hanakai" http://www.am-cb.net/projets/hakanai/ Submission deadline: 1st of March 2015 (5:00pm PST) [Apologies for cross-posting. Authority data held in<br>library systems, including classification schemes find new ways of expanding its<br>potential as shared knowledge structures across the linked data environment.<br>The objective of this conference is to explore such a potential, expanding the<br>value and use of classification as [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-02-03T11:40:36+00:00 2015-02-03T11:40:36+00:00 [3rd CFP] International Conference on Computational Creativity 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;7e204b18.1502 On 03/02/2015 00:33, "Michael Cook" <mtc06@DOC.IC.AC.UK> wrote:<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>The new year is underway and ICCC 2015's deadline is approaching! The deadline for early-bird bookings for this year's VRA conference in Denver is a week this Friday (6 February). Please see further details in the email below.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Vicky Brown, Visual Resources Curator<br>History of Art Department, University of Oxford<br>Suite 9, Littlegate House<br>St Ebbes<br>Oxford OX1 1PT<br>UK [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-01-26T15:56:29+00:00 2015-01-26T15:56:29+00:00 ARLIS Committee for Art & Design Archives, Copyright Study Day https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;53694b5f.1501 on behalf of ARLIS Committee for Art & Design Archives [bookings.art@GMAIL.COM]<br><br>Keeping Within the Lines: Approaches to Copyright in Art and Design Archives<br><br>London Metropolitan Archives, London<br>Friday 13 March, 10.15am - 5pm<br><br>Organised by ARLIS/UK & Ireland, Committee for Art & Design Archives (CADA) in partnership with The National Archives and the ‘Archiving the Arts’ initiative. [...] Aliya Sayakhova 2015-01-19T17:24:08+00:00 2015-01-19T17:24:08+00:00 Lecture series at Leighton House - Aesthetics and Display of Islamic Art https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;4fe776c1.1501 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Apologies about cross-posting. Please find below information about the lecture series on Aesthetics and Display of Islamic Art (20 Jan-17 March), which I hope will be of interest.<br><br>The second semester of IESA's year-long lecture programme on Collecting, Communicating and Display of Islamic Art starts tomorrow. The strand is devoted to Aesthetics and Display of Islamic Art, and will examine the different media of the art of the Islamic world: architecture, glass, ceramics, metalwork and painting. However, instead of focusing on particular periods and geographical areas, following a chronological order, as done by most traditional courses, the structure of the programme allows the audience to explore the artistic forces, cultural patterns and creative principles of Islamic visuality throughout time and space.<br><br>Firstly, the sessions concentrate on the aesthetic principles underlying the different modes of visual expression including ornament, geometry, calligraphy, figurative representation and the making of objects of material culture. Secondly, the course explores issues of communication and display of Islamic art in museums and cultural centres both historically and today.<br><br>This strand of the course will discuss the emergence of institutional collecting, the role of museums and their engagement of the public, and the different meanings given to Islamic art in cultural institutions inside and outside the Muslim context. The course comprises 8 study days and one day of visits. The lectures are given by a range of scholars, experts and museum curators including Rebecca Bridgeman (Curator of Islamic and South Asian Arts at Birmingham Museums), Hettie Elgood (Course Director of the Diploma in Asian Art at SOAS), William Greenwood (Curator of Metalwork, Museum of Islamic Art, Doha), Valerie Gonzales (primary tutor of the course, PhD in Human Sciences, the University of Aix-en-Provence, Department of Islamic and Arabic Art and Architecture).<br><br>The programme takes place every Tuesday, 10am to 3.15pm at Leighton House Museum (London).<br><br>Fees:<br>-Individual sessions \ufffd\ufffd85<br>-Semester \ufffd\ufffd750<br>Concessions available for senior citizens and students.<br><br>To book and for further information please visit www.iesa.edu or contact Aliya Sayakhova a.sayakhova@iesa.edu Sue Gollifer 2015-01-15T08:07:49+00:00 2015-01-15T08:07:49+00:00 ISEA2015: Last Deadlines Extension https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;1452aed2.1501 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;1452aed2.1501">ISEA2015: Last Deadlines Extension </a> Sue Gollifer 2015-01-09T16:25:34+00:00 2015-01-09T16:25:34+00:00 FW: Interdisciplinary Residency 2015 - open to applications, deadline 19 January https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;a2541d45.1501 From: Laura Simpson - Hospitalfield Arts <laura@HOSPITALFIELD.ORG.UK<mailto:laura@HOSPITALFIELD.ORG.UK>> Hospitalfield is pleased to announce: Interdisciplinary Programme 2015 March and August 2015 residencies open for applications Deadline: 19 January 2015, midnight \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Residency Period: 16 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 29 March 2015 and Residency Period: 17 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 30 August 2015 Eligibility: International and UK-based artists, writers, architects, producers, dancers, choreographers, commissioners, curators, designers, educators, researchers and others developing their working lives within the scope of contemporary cultural practices. Places: 8 for March and 8 for August. Cost: \ufffd\ufffd630 for a two week full board residency with work space. Selectors: Ewan Imrie, Collective Architecture; Nicola White, Writer; [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-01-08T11:38:18+00:00 2015-01-08T11:38:18+00:00 CALL FOR MANUSCRIPTS: International Journal for Digital Art History https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;469bcde7.1501 Call for Manuscripts<br><br>The Digital Age has revolutionized economy, society and our private lives. For decades now, digitalization has also touched most branches of the humanities. With the rising importance of the so called Digital Humanities, Art History is about to change significantly. Since the slide library is irreversibly replaced by image databases, the fact that our media have turned digital opens up to new possibilities. Academic books and journals are increasingly accessed and published via internet. Data-driven approaches enable us to visualize large data-sets and big image data. Computer vision, gamification and citizen science spur new epistemic approaches. [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-01-08T10:28:58+00:00 2015-01-08T10:28:58+00:00 Call For Proposals: Where to?: Steps Towards the Future of Walking Arts https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;ce06a367.1501 From: <Myers>, Misha <Misha.Myers@FALMOUTH.AC.UK<mailto:Misha.Myers@FALMOUTH.AC.UK>><br>REMINDER: Proposals due 19 January<br><br>In partnership with the AHRC Walking Artist Network, the Articulating Space Research Centre at Falmouth University is hosting a symposium to consider the future of walking arts in relation to three key themes: the diversity of forms and growth of interest in walking art practices, the regional particularities in walking (art), and the politics of walking (art). [...] Sue Gollifer 2015-01-07T12:08:20+00:00 2015-01-07T12:08:20+00:00 CFP: Creativity and Cognition - Glasgow https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;1c234c08.1501 The call for Creativity and Cognition Glasgow has been extended to Monday Jan 12th, 11:59 PM PST<br><br>Call for Participation<br>ACM Creativity and Cognition, Glasgow School of Art (22-25th June 2015)<br><br>Web Site<br>http://www.creativityandcognition.com/cc15<br><br>Important Dates<br><br>Deadline for papers submission: 12th January 2015<br><br>Deadline for poster, demonstrations, workshop and artworks submission: 6th March 2015<br><br>General Information<br>ACM Creativity and Cognition 2015 invites papers, posters, demonstrations workshops and Artworks investigating how interactive computing systems and sociotechnical processes affect creativity. We cherish creativity as a wonderful aspect of human experience, transformative and potentially transcendental. Creativity is the partner of inspiration, of moments [...] Cara Courage 2015-01-03T17:45:34-00:00 2015-01-03T17:45:34-00:00 CALL FOR PAPERS - RGS-IBG Annual International Conference 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTNET-ALL;a98ff98c.1501 Second call, apologies for cross-posting<br>Session: \ufffd\ufffdCreative placemaking and beyond\ufffd\ufffd<br>Session convenors:<br>* Cara Courage, University of Brighton and urban arts and placemaking<br>practitioner.<br>* Anita McKeown, NCAD, Dublin and Itinerant Artist and researcher.<br><br>The arts-driven placemaking sector has reached a moment in both maturity and<br>diversity where it demands a critique and deeper understanding of practice.<br>This session will expand on discussions at RGS2014 on the role of arts in<br>place and co-production, specifically focusing on notions of creative<br>placemaking (Markusen & Gadwa 2010) and socially-engaged placemaking<br>practices and their potential vis-\ufffd\ufffd-vis the Anthropocene and citizens<br>activity taking the [...]
